metadata.title: CVE-2016-2070 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The tcp_cwnd_reduction function in net/ipv4/tcp_input.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.3.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(divide-by-zero error and system crash) via crafted TCP traffic.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required
